main_definition: To a greater degree or extent.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To a greater degree or extent.
meanings_and_examples.example: I could no more climb that than fly!

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to form the comparative form of adjectives and adverbs.
meanings_and_examples.example: You're more beautiful than I ever imagined.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In negative constructions: any further, any longer; any more.
meanings_and_examples.example: I don't want to hear any more excuses.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used in addition to an inflected comparative form.
meanings_and_examples.example: I was more better at English than you.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A greater number or quantity (of something).
meanings_and_examples.example: There isn't enough salt in this. You need to add more.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An extra or additional quantity (of something).
meanings_and_examples.example: There aren't many people here yet, but more should be arriving soon.
